Class SourceCounter

java.lang.Object
analysis.SourceCounter
All Implemented Interfaces:
LogAnalyzer
public class SourceCounter extends Object implements LogAnalyzer
SourceCounter is responsible for counting how many times each source appears in the log entries. It also provides methods for identifying the most and least common sources. The class is thread-safe and suitable for parallel processing.

  • Method Details

    • analyze

      public void analyze(String source)
      Increments the count for the given log source.
      Specified by:
      analyze in interface LogAnalyzer
      Parameters:
      source - the source string (e.g. "Server1", "Database") to be counted

    • getSourceCounts

      public Map<String,Integer> getSourceCounts()
      Returns a map of all sources and their associated counts.
      Returns:
      a map where the key is the source name and the value is the number of times it appeared

    • getMostCommonSource

      public String getMostCommonSource()
      Finds and returns the name of the source that appeared most frequently.
      Returns:
      the most common source name, or null if no sources were counted

    • getMostCommonSourceCount

      public int getMostCommonSourceCount()
      Returns the number of times the most common source appeared.
      Returns:
      the highest source count, or 0 if none exist

    • getLeastCommonSource

      public String getLeastCommonSource()
      Finds and returns the name of the source that appeared least frequently.
      Returns:
      the least common source name, or null if no sources were counted

    • getLeastCommonSourceCount

      public int getLeastCommonSourceCount()
      Returns the number of times the least common source appeared.
      Returns:
      the lowest source count, or 0 if none exist
